frame.name: Be_in_agreement_on_action
frame.definition:
<def-root>Two (or more) people (the <fen>Parties</fen>, also encodable as <fen>Party_1</fen> and <fen>Party_2</fen>) have an agreement. Both sides are construed as having a commitment to an <fen>Obligation</fen>--the relationship is understood to be symmetrical or reciprocal. Instead of a specific mention of the <fen>Obligation</fen>, a <fen>Topic</fen> expression may be used to indicate the domain covered.
<ex><fex name="Parties">The US and Russia</fex> have an <t>agreement</t> <fex name="Obligation">to share early warning data on missile launches</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Party_1
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i.e. agentive) party of the agreement, as compared with <fen>Party_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Party_1</fen> is generally encoded as the External Argument of verbs, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Party_1</fen>. Thus <fen>Manner</fen> is construed to be that of <fen>Party_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Party_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Parties</fen> as a whole.
<ex><fex name="par1">AOL 's</fex> <t>agreement</t> with the ACLU will soon expire , and renogotiation is not a real possibility .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Party_2
FE.definition:
<def-root>The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent participant (or group of participants) in the agreement. It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by with).
<ex>Mozilla Foundation now has a binding<t>agreement</t> <fex name="par2">with America Online</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Obligation
FE.definition:
<def-root>An expression of the commitment of the <fen>Parties</fen> .
<ex>The US and Russia have an <t>agreement</t> <fex name="obl">to share early warning data on missile launches</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Topic</fen> is a description of the domain covered by the agreement.
<ex>Some types of alloy steel have been covered in the expiring <fex name="top">trade</fex> <t>agreement</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition:
<def-root>As with other frames in the Communication domain, the <fen>Medium</fen> of communication may be expressed. <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to record or negotiate the <fen>Obligation</fen>.
<ex>The parties have a <fex name="med">written</fex> <t>agreement</t> to arbitrate disputes arising in connection with the contract.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Parties
FE.definition:
<def-root>The group of individuals portrayed as equally involved in having an agreement.
<ex><fex name="pars">The US and Russia</fex> have an <t>agreement</t> to cooperate in destroying surplus portable anti-aircraft missiles.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an agreement was made.
<ex>The <fex name="pla">Kyoto</fex> <t>treaty</t> has so far been relatively ineffectual.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the agreement was made.
<ex>The missile <t>agreement</t> <fex name="tim">of 1952</fex> was still in force, however.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the agreement not specified by the other FEs, including particularly salient characteristics of the parties.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a characteristic or description of the agreement_on_action. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: treaty.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A formal agreement between two or more nations governed by international law

lexUnit.name: agreement.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: negotiated and typically legally binding arrangement.

lexUnit.name: deal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an agreement entered into by two or more parties for their mutual benefit.

lexUnit.name: convention.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an agreement between states, especially one less formal than a treaty.

lexUnit.name: strike.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: come to an agreement, result in some course of action. NOTE: this LU has a limited number of collocates that may occur with the verb (e.g. 'a deal', 'an agreement', ' an alliance', 'a balance', 'an accord', etc.)
